channel.title: Really simple, quick question to make sure this works

item.title: Really simple, quick question to make sure this works
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

	public void GenerateNPC(final client c) {
		if ((c.combatLevel >= 3) && (c.combatLevel <= 24)) {
			c.sM("You need a combat level of 25 of higher to enter a Dungeon.");
		} else if ((c.combatLevel >= 25) && (c.combatLevel <= 50)) {
			server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(0000, 0000, 0000, c.heightLevel);
		}
	}

Here.
I’m not exactly sure what you need but here.

item.title: Really simple, quick question to make sure this works
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Looks good, but use this.

public void GenerateNPC(client c) { if(c.combatLevel >= 3 && c.combatLevel <= 24) { c.sM("You need a combat level of 25 of higher to enter a Dungeon."); } else if(c.combatLevel >= 25 && c.combatLevel <= 50) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(0000, 0000, 0000, c.heightLevel); } }

item.title: Really simple, quick question to make sure this works
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

well, im like 99% sure this works, but i just want to make sure, so lets begin

This:

[code]public void GenerateNPC1(client c) {
if(c.combatLevel >= 3 && c.combatLevel <= 24) {
c.sM(“You need a combat level of 25 of higher to enter a Dungeon.”);
}
}

public void GenerateNPC2(client c) {
if(c.combatLevel >= 25 && c.combatLevel <= 50) {
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(0000, 0000, 0000, c.heightLevel);
}
}[/code]

Is the same as this right?:

public void GenerateNPC(client c) { if(c.combatLevel >= 3 && c.combatLevel <= 24) { c.sM("You need a combat level of 25 of higher to enter a Dungeon."); else if(c.combatLevel >= 25 && c.combatLevel <= 50) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(0000, 0000, 0000, c.heightLevel); } } }

just need to make sure
